message: What are the best mind mapping web apps currently available? Free or paid?
I've used Freemind (http://freemind.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Main_Page), but it's not a web-app.  You could try workflowy (http://workflowy.com/) (outlines are kind of like mindmaps).
I use http://bubbl.us/ and it works great.
I also found http://www.mind42.com/ which seems to work well. Mindmeister looks great, but sometimes loads really slow.
I've been using Xmind within our organization - Its based on Eclipse and has a free and paid version (Desktop Only).  I'd like to find something web-based thats as good as Xmind.

Workflowy looks nice, very friendly and smooth with those Javascript animations, but it doesnt appear to offer the visual gusto of a mind mapper... This is too bad considering that the data structures of a nested list and mind map are identical. hrm.

Here's a decent list of mind mappers for the web: http://www.mind-mapping.org/web-based-mindmappers/details.html ... Googling also shows a couple more blog posts about mind mapping apps in general, but there appear to be no killer HTML based, APIified mind mapping apps.  So, this might be a good market for someone to tap.
@tronathan great list. Thank you for the link!
LucidChart does mind mapping and supports a ton of other types of diagrams.  I've only used it for ER diagrams and flow charts but it's the closest thing to Visio in the cloud I've found.
